title-group.article-title: Stability of Difference Approximations of Dissipative Type for Mixed Initial-Boundary Value Problems.

abstract.p: H. O. Kreiss, [2], has recently extended the stability theory of difference approximations to include the hyperbolic system <tex-math>$u_t = A u_x, \quad 0 \leqq x, t$</tex-math>, with A a diagonal matrix. Appropriate boundary and initial conditions are given. The amplification matrix <tex-math>$\hat Q(\xi)$</tex-math> need not be diagonal. However, he required that <tex-math>$|\hat Q(\xi)| \leqq 1$</tex-math>. We use certain results in matrix theory and Wiener-Hopf factorization to replace this restrictive assumption by certain reasonable assumptions on accuracy of <tex-math>$\hat Q(\xi)$</tex-math> and smoothness of an associated positive-definite symmetric matrix. This technique will be important in half-space problems in many space variables since for such problems the amplification matrix will certainly not be diagonal.
